text.p: Don't forget to checkout on the last page when you finished the quiz. You are given a variable n_str, type str, containing numeric characters only. Write a program that prints the sum of all the digits in n_str.
text.pre: # when n_str == "123", print 6 # when n_str == "007", print 7
text.p: Enter your Python code for problem 1 here. Click the blue Submit button to make sure that you copied your code correctly and that it passes our basic tests.
Do not include input statements or define n_str. Our graders will provide values for you, so write your code assuming that n_str is already defined.

problem.p: Note: An L379 or L397 error: means that your code has an infinite loop for some test case. You will receive a zero for this problem if your code has an infinite loop.

Note on Score Shown: Your code will ultimately be run on our test cases. Getting "Correct"/green check during the exam does not mean you will get full points. The test cases here ensures you do not have a copy/paste error from your IDE.
